title: Dem. transition; institutions in Russia and Mexico

content.prompt: Which of the following is true of the transitions to democracy in Mexico and Russia?

choices.label: International isolation spurred the process in both countries.
The military played a pivotal role in the process in both countries.
Religious institutions in both countries became discredited by their affiliation with the prior regime.
In Mexico old institutions were reformed, while in Russia new institutions were created.
In both Mexico and Russia, new legislatures had to be created.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
